New Records: Rachin Ravindra became the highest run-getter in this World Cup.
Rachin Ravindra broke Sachin Tendulkar's record.
Trent Boult became the first New Zealander to take 50 wickets in World Cups.
Maheesh Theekshana and Dilshan Madushanka achieved their career-best scores in ODI cricket.
Sri Lanka's 43-run partnership for the tenth wicket was their highest in all World Cups.
Key Match Events: New Zealand won by 5 wickets with 160 balls remaining.
Trent Boult was named Player of the Match.
Daryl Mitchell attacked with two sixes down the ground.
Angelo Mathews dismissed Kane Williamson for 14 off 15 balls.
Maheesh Theekshana dismissed Rachin Ravindra for 42.
Devon Conway fell five short of a half-century.
Mitchell Santner took 2 wickets for 22 runs in 10 overs.
Kusal Perera scored the fastest half-century in this World Cup off 22 balls.
Trent Boult took two wickets in the first powerplay.
Lockie Ferguson dismissed Kusal Perera for 51 off 28 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Kane Williamson mentioned the weather influenced his decision to bowl first.
Sri Lanka made one change, bringing in Chamika Karunaratne for Kasun Rajitha.
New Zealand brought in Lockie Ferguson for Ish Sodhi.
Kusal Mendis stated he would have preferred to bowl first as well.
Post-Match Reflections: Trent Boult expressed satisfaction with his performance and reaching the milestone of 50 World Cup wickets.
Angelo Mathews reflected on his campaign and the controversy surrounding his timed out dismissal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain was a factor in Bengaluru, potentially affecting the match.
Mitchell Santner's bowling was praised for its control and effectiveness.
Ravichandran Ashwin commented on Santner's unique bowling style and effectiveness.
